exam_title: Tech Fundamentals Quiz (Networking, Linux, and Git)

questions.question_text: What is a key responsibility of the Transport Layer in the OSI model?
Which protocol is connection-oriented, ensuring reliable data delivery?
An IP address is 192.168.1.15 with a CIDR notation of /24. How many usable host addresses are in this subnet?
What is the main function of a VPN Gateway?
options: To distribute content closer to users.
To monitor network traffic for viruses.
To establish a secure communication tunnel over a public network.
To assign dynamic IP addresses to devices.
questions.correct_answer: To establish a secure communication tunnel over a public network.

questions.question_text: What is a primary benefit of using a Content Delivery Network (CDN)?
options: It encrypts all local network traffic.
It reduces latency by caching content closer to users.
It provides private IP addresses for internal networks.
It is a replacement for a firewall.
questions.correct_answer: It reduces latency by caching content closer to users.

questions.question_text: Which command lists all files and directories, including hidden ones?
Which command prints the full path of the current working directory?
Which command is used to search for a specific pattern of text within a file?
How would you make a shell script named 'myscript.sh' executable?
What is the potential consequence of running the command 'rm -rf /'?
options: It recursively deletes all files and directories from the root, wiping the system.
questions.correct_answer: It recursively deletes all files and directories from the root, wiping the system.

questions.question_text: Which command is used to initialize a new Git repository in the current directory?
What does the 'git add' command do?
options: It adds a new user to the repository.
It stages changes to be included in the next commit.
It adds a new remote repository.
questions.correct_answer: It stages changes to be included in the next commit.

questions.question_text: Which command displays the commit history of the current branch?
How do you create a new branch named 'feature-x'?
What is the purpose of the 'git clone' command?
options: To create a copy of a local repository.
To create a copy of a remote repository on your local machine.
questions.correct_answer: To create a copy of a remote repository on your local machine.

questions.question_text: Which command uploads your local commits to a remote repository?
What information does 'git status' provide?
options: The network status of the remote.
The current branch, untracked files, and staged/unstaged changes.
A list of all branches in the repository.
questions.correct_answer: The current branch, untracked files, and staged/unstaged changes.

options: Changes to the user's home directory
questions.correct_answer: Changes to the user's home directory

questions.question_text: How do you search for the word 'error' in a file named 'app.log', ignoring case?
How can you view a condensed, one-line summary of the commit history?
What command switches you to an existing branch named 'develop'?
What happens if you have a 'merge conflict'?
options: Git automatically chooses the best change.
Git pauses the merge and asks you to manually resolve the conflicting changes.
questions.correct_answer: Git pauses the merge and asks you to manually resolve the conflicting changes.

questions.question_text: Which OSI layer is responsible for data encryption and formatting?
What is the primary purpose of the TCP three-way handshake?
options: To negotiate the data transfer speed
To synchronize sequence numbers and establish a connection
To encrypt the data before transmission
To choose between TCP and UDP
questions.correct_answer: To synchronize sequence numbers and establish a connection

questions.question_text: What is the broadcast address for the network 192.168.10.0/24?

options: It acts as a primary database

questions.question_text: Which command is used to create a new, empty file?
How do you create a new directory named 'projects'?
Which command is used to copy 'file1.txt' to 'file2.txt'?
How can you count the number of lines containing the word 'warning' in 'system.log'?
What do the permissions `777` signify for a file?
options: The owner can read/write, everyone else can only read
The owner, group, and others can all read, write, and execute
Only the owner can read, write, and execute
questions.correct_answer: The owner, group, and others can all read, write, and execute

questions.question_text: Which command is used to list the currently running processes?
How would you terminate a process with a Process ID (PID) of 1234?
How do you remove a file from the staging area (unstage it)?
What is the command to commit staged changes with a message?
How do you view the specific changes made in a particular commit hash?
What is the single command to create a new branch and switch to it immediately?
How do you delete a local branch named 'old-feature'?
What is the command 'git pull' a convenient shortcut for?
How do you add a new remote repository named 'backup' with a given URL?
In 'git status', what does it mean if a file is shown in red?
options: It is staged for the next commit
It has been modified but not yet staged
It is a new, untracked file
questions.correct_answer: It has been modified but not yet staged

questions.question_text: What is the primary purpose of 'git rebase'?
options: To integrate changes by re-writing commit history for a cleaner, linear history
questions.correct_answer: To integrate changes by re-writing commit history for a cleaner, linear history

options: Owner: read/write, Group: read, Others: read
Owner: read/execute, Group: read, Others: read
Owner: read/write/execute, Group: none, Others: none
questions.correct_answer: Owner: read/write, Group: read, Others: read
